page.title: 04High Gingerfield Stables
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Naughton own the racing stables at High Gingerfield. They usually have up to 20 horses. They do not breed horses but buy 3 year olds, either at Newmarket or Doncaster. They started the business in 1975. About 100 yards along the road there is an old racecourse which they use for training, some horses are flat racers, some jump. Flat racing jockeys have to weigh between 7st. to 10 st., but jumpers have to weigh between 10st and 12st. Mr. and Mrs. Naughton have four jockeys to ride and train the horses. Two of the jockeys work full time, and the other two work half time . Usually flat jockeys retire at 50, but if they jump they retire at 35. Two of the jockeys take the horses to the river in Richmond for exercise as the water strengthens their muscles.
